skill.name: payload
skill.description: Use when working with Payload CMS projects (payload.config.ts, collections, fields, hooks, access control, Payload API). Use when debugging validation errors, security issues, relationship queries, transactions, or hook behavior.
skill.summary: Use when working with Payload CMS projects (payload.config.ts, collections, fields, hooks, access co...

security_audit.summary: No data theft or malicious execution patterns detected. Network calls and environment variables appear only in documentation examples without exfiltration.

content.value_statement: Payload configuration and access control can be complex and error prone. This skill provides proven patterns and examples to guide secure implementation.
actual_capabilities: Provide Payload collection and field configuration examples.
Explain access control patterns including row level security.
Show hook usage with context and transaction safety.
Give Local API, REST, and GraphQL query examples.
Outline plugin architecture and extension patterns.
limitations: Does not run code or connect to your database.
Does not generate or store production secrets.
Examples require adaptation to your project schema.
No automated project scaffolding is performed.

use_cases.title: Design secure access rules
use_cases.description: Create read and write rules with role and tenant filters.

use_cases.title: Build collections quickly
use_cases.description: Define fields, relationships, drafts, and admin views.

use_cases.title: Extend Payload safely
use_cases.description: Add hooks, endpoints, and UI components with best practices.

prompt_templates.title: Create a basic collection
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a Posts collection with title, slug, author relationship, and draft status. Include admin defaults and timestamps.

prompt_templates.title: Add access control
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide an access control function that lets admins read all posts and authors read only their own posts.

prompt_templates.title: Safe hook workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Show an afterChange hook that writes to an audit-log collection and preserves transaction context.

prompt_templates.title: Plugin extension plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a plugin that adds SEO fields to selected collections and preserves existing hooks.

output_examples.input: How should I enforce user access in Local API queries?
output: Use overrideAccess: false when passing a user
Keep admin operations separate from user scoped queries
Document when access control is intentionally bypassed

best_practices: Pass req through nested operations to keep transactions atomic.
Use context flags to prevent infinite hook loops.
Limit returned fields with select to reduce overfetching.
anti_patterns: Passing a user without overrideAccess: false in Local API.
Creating hooks that call the same operation without context guards.
Using broad access rules when row level filters are needed.

faq.question: Is this compatible with Payload 3.x?
faq.answer: Yes, the guidance targets Payload 3.x and Next.js app directory usage.

faq.question: Does it generate a full project?
faq.answer: No, it provides guidance and patterns but does not scaffold files.

faq.question: Can it integrate with existing configs?
faq.answer: Yes, prompts can focus on adapting your current collections and hooks.

faq.question: Does it access my secrets or data?
faq.answer: No, it does not read local files or environment variables.

faq.question: What if my hooks still misbehave?
faq.answer: Share the hook and context usage so issues can be identified and corrected.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic CMS help?
faq.answer: It is tailored to Payload APIs, patterns, and known pitfalls.
